info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:26PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Eddy and southwestern Lea Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 526 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles northeast of Malaga, or 29 miles east of Carlsbad, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Eddy and southwestern Lea Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
